title: Water - Wikipedia
snippet: Water (H 2 O) is a polar inorganic compound.At room temperature it is a tasteless and odorless liquid, nearly colorless with a hint of blue.This simplest hydrogen chalcogenide is by far the most studied chemical compound and is described as the "universal solvent" for its ability to dissolve many substances. This allows it to be the "solvent of life": indeed, water as found in nature almost ...

title: Water | Definition, Chemical Formula, Structure, Molecule, & Facts ...
snippet: water molecule. The water molecule is composed of two hydrogen atoms, each linked by a single chemical bond to an oxygen atom. Most hydrogen atoms have a nucleus consisting solely of a proton. Two isotopic forms, deuterium and tritium, in which the atomic nuclei also contain one and two neutrons, respectively, are found to a small degree in water.

title: What is water? – 4-H Learning Network - Extension
snippet: What is water? Water is a colorless and odorless substance found all over Earth. Water is made up of billions of molecules. Each molecule is made of one oxygen and two hydrogen atoms held together by strong covalent bonds. Water is found in three different forms on Earth – gas, solid, and liquid. The form water takes depends on the temperature.
